ui

Interface UIFacade

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    UserInterface

    public interface UIFacade
    Interface for the userinterface. Any userinterface that is attached to this program has to implement all these methods somehow.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean askAdvance()
      Ask if the user wants to advance the assemblyline.
      boolean askContinue()
      Ask the user if he wants to continue.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the users' name.
        Returns:
        A String that represents the user's name.

      • chooseRole

        java.lang.String chooseRole()
        Let the user indicate which role he fulfills.
        Returns:
        A String that represents which role the user fulfills.

      • chooseModel

        java.lang.String chooseModel(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> catalogue)
        Choose the car model the user wants to order.
        Parameters:
        catalogue - A Set which contains Strings that represent the names of all possible car models that can be ordered.
        Returns:

      • askFinished

        java.lang.String askFinished()
        Ask if the user is finished.
        Returns:
        A String that equals either "Y" (for yes) or "N" (for no).

      • getQuantity

        int getQuantity()
        Let the user indicate how many cars he wants to order.
        Returns:
        a positive integer representing the quantity

      • chooseWorkBench

        int chooseWorkBench(int numberOfWorkbenches,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> workbenches)
        Let the user indicate which workbench he's working at.
        Parameters:
        numberOfWorkbenches - Integer that represents how many workbenches the user can choose from.
        workbenches - ArrayList that contains Strings. Each String represents the name of one of the workbenches.
        Returns:
        A strictly positive integer. The integer 'n' that is returned indicates the user chooses the n'th element in the given list.

      • chooseTask

        int chooseTask(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> tasks)
        Let the user indicate which task he wants to perform.
        Parameters:
        tasks - ArrayList that contains Strings. Each String represents the description of one of the tasks.
        Returns:
        A strictly positive integer. The integer 'n' that is returned indicates the user chooses the n'th element in the given list.

      • showChosenTask

        void showChosenTask(java.lang.String task)
        Show the user the task he has chosen.
        Parameters:
        task - A String that represents the task. This String contains the task description, "Required actions:", and all the actions required. Each of these elements are separated by a comma.

      • askContinue

        boolean askContinue()
        Ask the user if he wants to continue.
        Returns:
        A String that equals either "Y" (for yes) or "N" (for no).

      • invalidAnswerPrompt

        void invalidAnswerPrompt()
        Notify the user that the answer he has given is not a valid answer.

      • invalidUserPrompt

        void invalidUserPrompt()
        Notify the user that the answer he has given is not a valid user.

      • showPendingOrders

        void showPendingOrders(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> pendingOrders)
        Show the user's pending orders.
        Parameters:
        pendingOrders - An ArrayList of Strings. Each String in this ArrayList represents an order. It contains the quantity, the name of the model and the estimated time, all separated by comma's.

      • showCompletedOrders

        void showCompletedOrders(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> completedOrders)
        Show the user's completed orders.
        Parameters:
        pendingOrders - An ArrayList of Strings. Each String in this ArrayList represents an order. It contains the quantity and the name of the model, separated by comma's.

      • showWorkBenchCompleted

        void showWorkBenchCompleted()
        Notify the user that all the tasks at the workbench he's working on are completed.

      • showOrder

        void showOrder(int quantity,
             java.lang.String carModel,
             int[] estimatedTime)
        Show the user the order he is about to place.
        Parameters:
        quantity - An integer representing the quantity of cars the user is about to order.
        carModel - A String representing the name of the carmodel the user is about to order.
        estimatedTime - The estimated completion time, represented by two integers: the day and the time (in minutes). If the estimated completion time == -1, the completion time can't be shown.

      • showAssemblyLine

        void showAssemblyLine(java.lang.String assemblyline,
                    java.lang.String tense)
        Show the user the assemblyline.
        Parameters:
        assemblyline - A String representing the assemblyline. The String contains all the workbenches in the assemblyline and all the tasks at each workbench (with indication whether the task has been completed), each of them separated by a comma.
        tense - String that indicates whether the other parameter is a current or future assemblyline.

      • getElapsedTime

        int getElapsedTime()
        Let the user indicate how much time has passed.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the elapsed time (in minutes).

      • showBlockingBenches

        void showBlockingBenches(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> notCompletedBenches)
        Show the user which benches are keeping the assemblyline from advancing.
        Parameters:
        notCompletedBenches - A list of integers. Each integer represents the number of a workbench that is blocking the assemblyline.

      • askAdvance

        boolean askAdvance()
        Ask if the user wants to advance the assemblyline.
        Returns:
        A String that equals either "Y" (for yes) or "N" (for no).
